questiontext.text: Relational databases were originally designed to leverage distributed computing architectures

feedback.text: Most relational database systems were designed around single CPU mainframe and minicomputer systems.

questiontext.text: Key-values stores are searchable by the data within the value portion of a key-value pair.

feedback.text: You can only lookup items in a key-value store based on the data within a key.

questiontext.text:
Which of the following are considered NoSQL database architectural patterns:
a) binary trees
b) hash-tables
c) graph stores
d) object-oriented databases

feedback.text: The four new architectures are key-values stores, column-family stores, graph stores and document stores.

questiontext.text:
An XML database is considered what type of NoSQL database pattern:
a) key-value store
b) column-family store
c) graph stores
d) document store

feedback.text: XML databases hold hierarchical documents where all elements and attributes can be queried.

questiontext.text: Which of the following patterns is used in distributed computing. a) move data to the queries b) move queries to the data

feedback.text: Queries are generally much smaller than data so it is usually much more efficient to move queries to the data.

questiontext.text:
Which of the following best describes the use of consistent hashing a) a way to assign a data element to a node in a cluster
b) a way to encrypt data to prevent unauthorized access
c) a way to lookup joins when tables are on different nodes d) a way to keep data consistent within a table

feedback.text: Consistent hashing allows any node in a cluster to determine what node a data item is located.
